hollow.t: A hollow book holds two worlds: the one you read and the one you hide.
Every library is a labyrinth, and some doors open only for the patient.
The weight of a book isn’t measured in paper, but in the secrets it keeps.
Between the covers, the clock forgets how to tick.
Some stories are keys, some are locks—you only know which when you turn the last page.
A hidden chapter is the truest kind of treasure.
Light falls differently on a page when it’s read in silence.
